reviews.review: If you love puzzles that make you feel like a genius, charterers that make you laugh out loud, and a story that is compelling the whole time, play Portal 2. If you haven't played the first, you don't need to play the first to enjoy the second, but I would still recommend playing both just because both are amazing games.
Best Game EVER! You'll never regret to buy it.
get this game on sale for $1 its SO good
Jogo muito bom, que vc perde muitas horas quebrando a cabeÃ§a, divertido jogar sozinho e com algum amigo. Super recomendo!!!
Good game, the puzzle solving is fun. Great game.
It's Portal 2. A classic in the same league as the original, Halo, CoD, Age of Empires, or any other essential video game. Do I really have to sell you on this?

When life gives you lemons, don't make lemonade. Make life take the lemons back! Get mad! I don't want your damn lemons, what the heck am I supposed to do with these? Demand to see life's manager! Make life rue the day it thought it could give Cave Johnson lemons! Do you know who I am? I'm the man who's gonna burn your house down! With the lemons! I'm gonna get my engineers to invent a combustible lemon that burns your house down!
Muito bom jogo de puzzle, precisa de ter em mÃ©dia 200 de QI para terminar, Ã© meio complicado
Really good game my favorite game love how you have to solve puzzles and in the meanwhile you have a great story line.

I love portal 2, I don't play videogames all that much but that's what makes portal 2 beautiful. You don't need to be good at shooters and game experience doesn't help you. It's just a fun time that you can always hop in to, or come back to. I've played it 3 and I'm working on the 4th time right now haha.
Portal here portal there, puzzle completed.
Gameplay, story, and mechanics are all gorgeous!

[i]Portal 2[/i] is the same as [i]Portal[/i], but worse.
The gameplay is the exact same, with a few new gimmicks. This is fine, as the first game was perfectly acceptable.

It is impossible to change fov. This is unacceptable in any first person game, especially disappointing considering you could in the first game.
At least one of the puzzles has a softlock, forcing you to reload. It's not hard to do, either. 
Additionally quite a few of the puzzles are obtuse, with solutions so ridiculous it's surprising anyone could beat them without a guide.

The ending is amazing however, unlike the first game.
